comment.author: 44316359@N00
comment._content: I wish that the windows on the second floor around the atrium were still open.  I know museum curator (and lighting designers)  don't like to deal with natural light, but those areas around the arches are in such dire need for something to enliven them, and I think that a return to a more historical look in these zones may be the answer.  many of the exhibits are already in traditional glass cases, so I think this approach makes sense.

comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/theludingtonite] The only problem is the lightwells that used to provide light into the exhibits via the windows are completely gone, and have been converted into collections storage space. The windows and the lightwells that fed light as is seen here just don't plain exist anymore. Completely gone.
